>
>
>Does JUnit generate automated tests, by analyzing the
>source code, to cover the maximum number of code
>lines?
>
The problem with this approach is that you are testing... what you 
wrote, and not what you should have written!  If you see a function, can 
you tell if the code is right without knowing what the function should 
do?  No.  So no automated generation tool can achieve that.

What I am trying to do is to write a tool to generate a template for 
your tests.  If you have a method that throw 3 exceptions, you should 
have at least 3 methods to test each exception ...

-Vladimir
